problem_text:
Suppose that a finite soluble group G admits a soluble group of automorphisms A of coprime order such that CG(A) has rank r. Let |A| be the product of l not necessarily distinct primes. Is there a linear function f such that G/Ff(l)(G) has (|A|, r)-bounded rank, where Ff(l)(G) is the f(l)-th Fitting subgroup?
An exponential function f with this property was found in (E. Khukhro, V. Mazurov, Groups St. Andrews 2005, vol. II, Cambridge Univ. Press, 2007, 564–585). It is also known that |G/F2l+1(G)| is bounded in terms of |CG(A)| and |A| (Hartley–Isaacs).
E. I. Khukhro
